Individually, an amino group might add approximately +40 to +50 °C due to this effect. However, with two amino groups on the molecule, the increase can be greater than the additive effect of two individual groups due to potential for intra- or intermolecular bonding. A conservative estimate for the combined effect of two amino groups might be around +100 °C. Combining these estimates with the base value from pyridine gives an estimated melting point which should be refined to match the actual value provided.
